_header: Henry sayeth my Son as thy Sovereign hath th’assembly assigned
Subjects: occasional verse; Virgin Mary; Henry VII
_description: Welcome to Henry VII at York in 1486: Speech of the Virgin Mary — one 8-line and one 10-line stanzas

BLCottJulBXII.First Lines:
Henry sith my sone as thy souueraigne hath the sothly assignedOf
                    his grace to be gouernor of his peoplez proteccon…
BLCottJulBXII.Last Lines:
…Contynuelly her in thy Rennyng I the pray in this spaceI
                    shall shewe to my sonne to sende thee his grace
BLCottJulBXII.Note:
‘Our lady’ written in the left margin (f. 11v).
                    Final lines continue into margin. Folio number reflects the most recent
                    foliation.
BLCottJulBXII.Editions:
Smith,  A. H. 
             “A York Pageant, 1486.” 
             London Medieval Studies
         1 (1937-39): 382-98: 394-5.

YorkCity6.First Lines:
Henrie seth my sone as thi sufferayne haith te sembly assynydOf his
                    grace to be gouerner for his people Election…
YorkCity6.Last Lines:
…Continuall heir in this reynyngI shall sew to my sone to
                    sendyou his grace
